meanings.definition: The state of being preoccupied or engrossed in thought or activity.
meanings.sent1: Her preoccupancy with the upcoming exam made it hard for her to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent2: His constant preoccupancy with work often caused him to forget about his personal life.
meanings.sent3: The cat's preoccupancy with chasing shadows entertained the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The preoccupancy of the detective with solving the case led to him neglecting his own well-being.
meanings.sent5: The preoccupancy of the artist with creating the perfect masterpiece consumed all his time and energy.

meanings.definition: The act of preoccupying or occupying beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The preoccupancy of setting up the stage before the concert was crucial for a smooth performance.
meanings.sent2: The preoccupancy of booking the venue in advance saved them from last-minute stress.
meanings.sent3: The preoccupancy of preparing the ingredients ahead of time made cooking dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The preoccupancy of reserving the tickets early ensured they got the best seats in the theater.
meanings.sent5: The preoccupancy of packing the night before the trip made the morning departure hassle-free.
